item.title: MacOS Safari cannot install extension solution
item.description: <p>Some old MacOS user may notice that installing Safari extention is not working like before in new system. &#x201C;Install now&#x201D; is no longer exist, it was replaced by &#x201C;Trust&#x201D;. However, when click the &#x201C;Trust&#x201D; button to install external extension, extension will not be installed in to Safari. That has nothing to do with the extension compatible issue.</p> <p>This seems like a bug on the &#x201C;Trust&#x201D; button. Mouse click on the &#x201C;Trust&#x201D; button is ignored. However, there is a trick to get this work. We can use keyboard to confirm the installation. Before that, we need to enable the keyboard control access in Windows and dialogs. For OS X 10.11.* or maybe later version if bug still exist. Go to System Preferences &gt; Keyboard &gt; Shortcuts &gt; Full Keyboard Access, select &#x201C;All controls&#x201D;. Now we can press Tab key to move focus between button in Windows and dialogs. <img src="/2016/04/osx-10.11-keyboard-all-controls.png" alt="Osx 10.11 Keyboard All Controls"> Now try to install Safari extension, when the dialog pop up, do not use mouse to click the &#x201C;Trust&#x201D; button since it will not work, use keyboard instead. Press the &#x201C;tab&#x201D; key to move the focus to &#x201C;Trust&#x201D; button and hit space or return. Extension will be installed.</p>
